title: Jerry/fix llms callbacks issue
body:
from #7112 we type function args as *args, **kwargs in the callback wrappers for `chat`. but when we call `llm.chat` sometimes we pass in messages as a kwarg instead of an arg e.g. `llm.chat(messages=messages, ...)`. This causes any references of `args[0]` to throw an error since args is blank.

Here we explicitly define the messages signature.

title: fix for concurrent OpenAIAgent streaming issue + notebook that was able to reproduce the issue
body:
# Description

Ran into an issue where if I had multiple instances of `OpenAIAgent` streaming chat messages at the same time, we were getting really garbled up messages. Turns out thats because each of the responses from these `OpenAIAgent`s were using the same underlying `queue.Queue` instance to relay tokens from the OpenAI API. So the messages from the concurrent streams were getting interleaved with each other 😅

Luckily this is a one line fix where we just instantiate a new `queue.Queue` instance on the instantiation of each new `StreamingAgentChatResponse` instance.

I've also included a notebook that was able to reliably reproduce the issue before the fix and works fine after the fix.

## Type of Change

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

body:
# Description

Change the `OpenInferenceCallbackHandler` to use node IDs rather than node hashes. Node hashes were originally chosen because of an issue reading in legacy LlamaIndex persisted indexes, but the node IDs work with newer versions.

This issue was initially investigated [here](https://github.com/jerryjliu/llama_index/issues/7101), where we found that the issue disppear after re-indexing with a newer version of LlamaIndex.

title: added column comments in sql query
body:
# Description

Added use of column comments in `SQLDatabase.get_single_table_info()`. When column comments are present, the template produced looks like 

```
Table 'f1' has columns: col1 (VARCHAR(16777216)): 'Name', col2 (DECIMAL(38, 0)): 'Age', and foreign keys: .
```

I have not iterated much on the formatting, but testing shows improvements when column names are uninformative.

For columns without comment, the template remains as before.

Fixes #6996 

## Type of Change

- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

# How Has This Been Tested?
Neither SQLite nor duckdb supports column comments, so it is difficult to provide real unit tests. It has been manually tested against Snowflake, and against a sqlite database to make sure it works as expected with and without column comments.

- [x] I stared at the code and made sure it makes sense

title: Integrate Rockset as a vector store
body:
# Description

Added [Rockset](https://rockset.com/docs) as a vector store to llama index.

> Rockset is a real-time analytics database which enables queries on massive, semi-structured data without operational burden. Rockset is serverless and fully managed. It offloads the work of managing configuration, cluster provisioning, denormalization, and shard / index management. Rockset is also SOC 2 Type II compliant and offers encryption at rest and in flight, securing and protecting any sensitive data. Most teams can ingest data into Rockset and start executing queries in less than 15 minutes.

Added example notebook and integration tests. 

Ran `black` and `mypy` and everything's good.

## Type of Change

title: Refactor openai agent
body:
# Description

Refactor OpenAI agent classes. This was a collaborative effort with @lacico. FAO @logan-markewich  

This eliminates some code duplication, which should (hopefully!) help make these classes more maintainable and easier to extend. 

There are a handful of minor API changes + correction of async behaviour.

These are:

- To support future development (see #6985), we included a simple `ChatMode` enum (with members `stream` and `default`), as an optional argument  in the signature of the `chat` and `achat` methods. This is because there are potentially several more possibilities to come if we aim to support all the combinations: 
  - the regular `chat` behaviour (a blocking function: current `chat`)
  - streaming the final outputs (a generator - current `stream_chat`) 
  - streaming the intermediate function calls along the way (even more relevant for the ReAct agent) for both async and async (an iterator of generators: not yet implemented)

- `StreamingAgentChatResponse.async_response_gen` was introduced to replace `StreamingAgentChatResponse.response_gen` for async applications. The previous async streaming functionality was not truly asynchronous, as one could not use it in an `async for` loop, because:
  - An internal `asyncio.run` ran coroutines in a separate thread, meaning these were scheduled independent of the main event loop.
  - The `StreamingAgentChatResponse.response_gen` was implemented as a property, which is synchronous.

- Factored out a `ChatSession` class from the `BaseOpenAIAgent` which handles all the session management responsibilities (memory/history, available tools and functions).


We also updated the concurrency to use `threading.Event` and `asyncio.Event` primitives, which avoided a few places with busy waiting in the current implementation.
Fixes #7075 

## Type of Change

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] This change requires a documentation update

# How Has This Been Tested?

We ran the test suite and OpenAI-agent related notebooks, except for that which requires a Pinecone subscription.

- [x] I updated the relevant notebooks to use the one entirely new user-facing method (async response stream)
- [x] I stared at the code and made sure it makes sense

# Suggested Checklist:

title: Retry strategies
body:
# Description
**Still need to do further testing but putting this up before that to get feedback on the direction**

This was motivated by the ["model overloaded"](https://community.openai.com/t/ratelimiterror-that-model-is-currently-overloaded-with-other-requests/197336) errors that OpenAI has a habit of throwing every now and then.

Adding a customizable retry strategy abstraction which can be attached to a `LLMPredictor` wrapper class.

Default behavior is to not do any retrying (i.e. use the `NoRetryStrategy` strategy). I was tempted to make `ExponentialBackoffRetryStrategy` be the default strategy but I figured that may incur unexpected additional API billing charges.

The `ExponentialBackoffRetryStrategy` uses [`tenacity`](https://tenacity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) for the implementation of the exponential backoff algorithm.

title: support async traces
body:
# Description

This PR fixes our traces for async events. In addition, some modifications were made to the wand callback to simplify code and improve the appearance in the frontend.

Async callback events are supported by using a `contextvar` for the trace stack. Now, the stack approach works because async tasks/threads will use a COPY of the stack, rather than continuing to use a shared stack. 

This way, the parent event Is properly tracked, and the trace map is correctly built.

## Type of Change

title: Infinite loop on long words
body:
# Description
Context: I am working on a project where I could use HuggingFace instruct models to generate a knowledge graph. I created a text processing pipeline and the pdf conversion resulted in very long words, e.g. table headers and rows. The text splitter entered an infinite loop. There is a one line change where I drop the content that goes over the max line length. I tested if over a number of docs.

I think it would be useful to log debug the number of splits, especially to get the sentence separator right.

The second change is related to showing progress in inserting a document.
